    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public void copy(java.lang.String relativePath)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Copies given file or directory (recursively) from the csar content directory to the transformation directory. After the successful call the copied files will reside in given path (relative to the transformation content dir)
        Parameters:
        relativePath - path to the source file relative to the csar content directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurred while copying

      • copy

        public void copy(java.lang.String relativeSourcePath,
                 java.lang.String relativeTargetPath)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Copies given file or directory (recursively) located at given relativeSourcePath to the given relativeTargetPath.

        Note: Will create new directories if necessary.

        Parameters:
        relativeSourcePath - path to the source file relative to the csar content directory
        relativeTargetPath - target location for the copy operation, relative to the transformation content dir
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occured while copying

      • access

        public PluginFileAccess.BufferedLineWriter access(java.lang.String relativePath)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a BufferedWriter which can write to given path.

        If necessary, creates missing subdirectories.

        Note: Close returned BufferWriter after usage.

        Tip (single-line usage): fileAccess.access("myPath").append("message").close()

        Parameters:
        relativePath - path to the target file, relative to the transformations root dir
        Returns:
        BufferedWriter which writes to target file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if given relativePath points to a directory
        java.io.IOException

      • accessAsOutputStream

        public java.io.BufferedOutputStream accessAsOutputStream(java.lang.String relativePath)
                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a BufferedOutputStream which can write to given path.

        This method is the ByteStream Counterpart to the access method.

        Please do not use this method to write Character encoded files, the regular access method is intended to handle Character based Streams.

        If necessary, creates missing subdirectories.

        Note: Close returned BufferedOutputStream after usage.

        Parameters:
        relativePath - path to the target file, relative to the transformations root dir
        Returns:
        BufferedOutputStream which writes to target file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if given relativePath points to a directory
        java.io.IOException

      • read

        public java.lang.String read(java.lang.String relativePath)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the content of a file in the csar content directory denoted by given path.
        Parameters:
        relativePath - path to a file contained in the csar content directory, relative said directory
        Returns:
        content of given file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file denoted by given relativePath does not exist or is a directory

      • getAbsolutePath

        public java.lang.String getAbsolutePath(java.lang.String relativePath)
                                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Parameters:
        relativePath - a path (relative to the transformation content directory) to a file or directory.
        Returns:
        the absolute path for given relativePath.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if no file is found for given relativePath

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Deletes file or directory (recusively) denoted by given path. If target does not exists, does nothing.
        Parameters:
        relativePath - relative (to the transformation content directory) path to a file or directory.

      • createDirectories

        public void createDirectories(java.lang.String relativePath)
        Creates folders recursively in the transformation content directory. Does nothing if folder already exists.
        Parameters:
        relativePath - relative (to the transformation content directory) path to a file or directory.
